Descriptions.Text:
Currently available to bona fide inhabitants of the Island specifically approved by the Minister who is wholly or mainly engaged in work of an agricultural nature in Jersey for his own benefit and profit.

Alternative uses will be considered (subject to planning). Consideration will be given to development (subject to planning) of the site for alternative commercial/agricultural opportunities.

Interested parties, please write to Box No. JEP J16658, PO Box 582, St. Saviour JE4 8XQ

The owners do not bind themselves to accept the highest or any offer.

We believe these particulars to be correct but do not accept any responsibility for any inaccuracies

A wonderful penthouse apartment enjoying plenty of sunshine with a spacious private sun deck enjoying plenty of afternoon sunshine.

In good order throughout, the property is an ideal solid investment unit, currently let at £894pcm (£10,728pa) and subject to a review soon. Comprising a large living room with adjacent kitchen area leading onto a west facing sun patio, a comfortable bedroom and en-suite bathroom. The property has no parking.

The property attracts a modest service charge of just £76.67 per calendar month.

Descriptions.Text:
A purpose built garden apartment, built in the 1960s in a popular position near to the Howard Davis Park. Overlooking spectacular communal gardens with a storage unit for bikes etc, the property is ready for some refurbishment. An area of garden to the front and rear are owned allowing the owner to maintain some personalised planting.

With 2 full double bedrooms, the kitchen offers plenty of space to eat in with an opportunity to open through to the living room.

The property owns a single garage in the block opposite, with the ability to park one small car in front.

Descriptions.Text:
An attractive first floor apartment in a purpose built 1960s block in a convenient location enjoying easy access to the town. Offering 3 double bedrooms, a modern bathroom and fitted kitchen, this is certainly spacious living at its best.

With full oil fired central heating and modern double glazing, the property offers great privacy and a sunny aspect over the communal garden. There is a secure single garage with electric shutter door, housing the oil fired boiler. It is in a very peaceful and private location, enjoying an outlook over the communal lawn to the south and views over the neighbouring meadow to the rear.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Descriptions.Text:
Quietly tucked away and surrounded on 3 sides by its modest but surprisingly private garden, this comfortable period house is maintained in good order throughout but will need some TLC from the new owner to bring the property up to a good standard.

With a comfortable living room with open fire, a spacious kitchen diner and a conservatory downstairs, there are 2 good double bedrooms and a third study/bedroom above.Modern wet electric central heating should keep everything warm and cosy in winter. 

Although there is no parking on site, the property qualifies for the nearby residents' parking scheme and disc parking allows plenty of opportunities for visiting guests.

Descriptions.Text: A substantial Victorian town house situated just ten minutes walk from the town centre which has been totally refurbished in recent years. With a safe enclosed rear patio garden, the main island secondary schools are within easy access. Just move in!
Descriptions.Name: SummaryText

Descriptions.Text:
This delightful Grade 3 listed Victorian house is bright and spacious, with a perfect blend of original character matched with modern contemporary finishes. Fully double glazed (secondary in part due to the listing), the property has been totally refurbished with all insulated outer walls and roof, complete re-wiring and new plumbing. There are 5 bedrooms (3 double and 2 singles), 2 bathrooms and a delightful living room with bay window, leading in to a fabulous family kitchen/diner. To the rear is a lovely enclosed patio garden, perfect for summer BBQs.

While there is no parking on site, there is a rented parking space included, pre-paid for 12 months. The property also qualifies for the residents' parking scheme for that area.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Descriptions.Text: A mixed commercial/residential investment property comprising a ground floor shop with ancillary storage/preparation areas, 2 x 1 bedroom apartments with storerooms (each let at £1,150 pcm on annual leases) and garaging for 3-4 cars.The shop, which has been established as a general store for over 60 years, is trading as a grocery/general store, with off-licence, coffee bar and take-away. The shop is let on a 9 year lease for £1,335 pcm, which commenced in 2018. The garage, stores, laundry room and one apartment were only built in 2002. Current gross yield £43,620 pa (£3,635pcm).

Descriptions.Text: A substantial two storey Georgian property backing onto Don Street and currently subdivided to incorporate ground floor restaurant, ancillary storage and eight studio apartments above. The restaurant has been an established business for many years. The fit out inside has been designed and maintained to a high standard with wooden flooring, spot lighting and air conditioning serving the seating areas. The ground floor also benefits from a fully fitted kitchen, two bar areas and cold store.

Descriptions.Text: If you are looking for a substantial home in a peaceful location, then look no further! Situated on a private cul-de-sac with very little passing traffic, the property is in a country location but only ten minutes from the town and the beach of St Aubin's Bay.Completely refurbished throughout just two years ago, the property is bright and sunny with new central heating and double glazing throughout. It offers accommodation either as a 5-6 bedroom home or as a two generation with 3 bedroom accommodation on the ground floor and a 2 bedroom unit on the first floor.There is considerable parking for 6-8 cars plus a detached garage/workshop. There is a sunny manicured front garden and a good sized kitchen garden to the rear.

SummaryTextDescription: The Apartments are situated opposite the beach at Greve de Lecq, and within walking distance to The Prince of Wales and a selection of cafes.

Flags.DisplayName: Approved For Marketing on Printed Media

Descriptions.Text:
This luxurious first floor apartment with sea views consists of 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, with a large open plan living area and an entrance hall with storage facilities. Les Verrieres Apartments offer bright and spacious, accommodation in Greve De Lecq bay with lovely views and easy access to the beach and local facilities that the bay has to offer. Attention has been paid to providing the owners of these luxury apartments with the latest and most efficient low cost energy systems. The property benefits from the provision of secure underground parking with direct access via a lift to all floors, whilst pedestrian access is available through the foyer. In addition, the basement provides for a lockable storeroom for each of the individual apartments
Flying Freehold
All mains services (except Gas)
Heading North through St Ouen's Village, turn right into Le Mont De Le Greve De Lecq. Les Verriers is at the foot of the hill on the right handside.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Features.Feature: Stunning Views over Greve de Lecq Beach

Descriptions.Text: If you are looking for a great example of a traditional Jersey granite homestead, look no further!!Recently refurbished by the present owner, this fine family home is the main dwelling in a small courtyard development and offers generously proportioned rooms, perfect for the growing family. Completely , the property enjoys plenty of parking to the north and a sunny enclosed south facing rear garden, perfect and safe for children and pets.The property boasts 4 bedrooms, each with a bathroom on the first floor and the second floor, currently an independent unit, lends itself to being a master suite.In great order throughout, the property lends itself to some light cosmetic finishes.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Features.Feature: Plenty of parking, scope for garage.

Descriptions.Text: Built in the 1800's this charming period semi detached property retains many original features to include fire places, staircase, doors and a host of other fixtures.  This established family home has a large living room, kitchen/breakfast room, four bedrooms and a house bathroom and shower room. Planning was permitted to knock down the existing kitchen/breakfast room and create a larger modern large kitchen living area and also to create a garage to the front of the property, (unfortunately this has now expired in March this year) this will need to be re instated by the new owners.  The property comes with a South facing garden and parking for three cars.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Descriptions.Text:
Tenure: Freehold

Services: All mains excluding gas, electric heating.

Directions: head into Gorey Village, and the property is situated on La Rue Hilgrove just after the small Grocery on the corner.

Descriptions.Text: Originally built in the 1970s, this lovely spacious detached house has been refurbished in recent years with  a new kitchen and bathrooms. There is a large south facing conservatory and all the main living areas are fitted with Amtico flooring, perfect for family living.
Descriptions.Name: SummaryText

Descriptions.Text:
Set in the heart of the countryside surrounded by a web of country lanes perfect for weekend walks, this detached family house has been lovingly maintained by the present owners, with both bathrooms and kitchen having been replaced in recent years.  

Upstairs their are four double bedrooms (one en suite) while the ground floor offers a sunny conservatory and a large open-plan living room with a cast-iron log burning stove, perfect for those winter nights.

A fully fitted utility room compliments a stylish fitted kitchen with breakfast bar.

Outside, there is ample parking in the bricked courtyard, leading to a detached single garage.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Descriptions.Text:
Tenure: Freehold

Services: All mains, bottled gas cooking, oil fired central heating

Directions: JT Maps 9Z11. Heading up the Trinity main road, bear left into La Rue dews Iffs, first left into la Rue Becq and The property is at the eastern end of La Rue D'Empierre on the right hand side.

Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 3

Descriptions.Text: St Helier - M243
Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 2

Descriptions.Text:
A substantial two generation property in a peaceful elevated position commanding views over St Aubin's Bay to Elizabeth Castle. With full oil central heating and double glazing the property offers versatile accommodation as a 4 bedroom main house and a 1 bedroom cottage, but with the ability to use the main house as a 3 bedroom and the the cottage therefore as a two bedroom. Also, there is a separate basement area, ideal as a games room for a young sibling, with a utility/kitchenette area and shower room.

Considerable work has already been undertaken with the replacement of the ground floor bathroom and a newly fitted kitchen. Care has been taken to upgrade the insulation with a number of walls now lined with therma-board to create cosy and economic environment.

There is a good sized parking area for 4 cars with a cedar wood storage shed,.

Services: All mains, no gas. Oil fired central heating.

Address.Street: Les Verrieres, Le Mont de la Greve de Lecq

SummaryTextDescription: The Apartments are situated opposite the beach at Greve de Lecq, and within walking distance to The Prince of Wales and a selection of cafes.

Flags.DisplayName: Approved For Marketing on Printed Media

Descriptions.Text: This luxurious first floor duplex apartment with sea views consists of 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (1 en suite) on the upper floor, with large open plan living area, separate utility room and an entrance hall with storage facilities on the lower level. Les Verrieres Apartments offer bright and spacious, accommodation in Greve De Lecq bay with lovely views and easy access to the beach and local facilities that the bay has to offer. Attention has been paid to providing the owners of these luxury apartments with the latest and most efficient low cost energy systems. The property benefits from the provision of secure underground parking with direct access via a lift to all floors, whilst pedestrian access is available through the foyer. In addition, the basement provides for a lockable storeroom for each of the individual apartments
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Features.Feature: Stunning Views over Greve de Lecq Beach

Descriptions.Text:
Tenure - Flying Freehold

Services - All mains excluding gas, touch button control lighting and under flooring heating, mechanical ventilation and heating recovery leading to energy efficiency and purified air

Directions - Heading North through St Ouen's village turn right into Le Mont De Le Greve De Lecq and Les Verrieres is at the foot of the hall on the right hand side

Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 3

Descriptions.Text:
This superb three bedroom, three bathroom cottage style property has an abundance of charm and character. Built approximately 11 years ago with the support of Jersey Heritage, the property is dressed with granite from the former barn on the site where this property now stands.

The spacious accommodation includes a bespoke hand crafted eat-in kitchen, large family room, formal living room, cloakroom and 3 bedroom suites. The exterior of the property has a large south facing raised decked area (with the opportunity to lawn if preferred) and parking for 6/7 cars.

Views over open pasture are enjoyed from the main living areas.

Completely refurbished regardless of cost only 3 years ago, this detached Art-Deco family house is perfectly situated for the growing family. With underfloor heating and a subtle contemporary feel, the property offers ideal accommodation within walking distance of all the main secondary schools and colleges.

With an enclosed sunny south facing garden, the property offers the best in modern day living.

Descriptions.Text:
A substantial detached Art-Deco family house, perfectly situated for local secondary schools and the Colleges, offering ideal accommodation for the growing family. With a sunny enclosed south facing garden, the property boasts an integral double garage and parking for 4 cars.

With stunning open plan living, the property has a beautiful fitted kitchen with a gas range, a study/snug, 2 master bedroom suites plus two family bedrooms and a house bathroom. Beautiful quality fixtures and fittings throughout.

There is a huge, undeveloped floored loft area providing considerable storage or lending itself to perhaps development of further accommodation, subject to Planning.

SummaryTextDescription: This substantial modern semi detached bungalow offers the buyer considerable scope and is situated on a little used lane in the heart of Trinity. Rondel's Farm Shop and nearby Sion village are within walking distance.

Flags.DisplayName: Approved For Marketing on Printed Media

Descriptions.Text:
Standing at the end of a long driveway, this substantial property boasts and large lawned tree lined garden with 2 equine paddocks adjacent. Offering a large sitting room and a magnificent open plan eat-in kitchen, the main accommodation offers a master suite of bedroom with en-suite bathroom and walk-in wardrobe, 3 family bedrooms and a house bathroom. A guest wing offers a further living room, bedroom and bathroom.

There are two generous sun terraces commanding views over the surrounding garden and the paddocks beyond. To the rear of the  property there is a timber storage building that could be adapted for use as a stable.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Tenure: Freehold

Descriptions.Text:
Built approximately ten years ago on the largest of three sites, this spacious modern house is of contemporary design, offering practical family accommodation with plenty of natural light.
There is a lovely enclosed sunny garden, overlooking rolling countryside with the sea in the far distance.
With a spacious living room and roomy eat-in kitchen, the property has 4 bedrooms, 2 south facing with wonderful lofty ceilings.
An enclosed brick paved driveway offers plentiful parking and leads to an integral garage.
A perfect home for the growing family.

SummaryTextDescription:
This detached period property stands on high ground at the western end of St Peter's Valley on a little used country lane, enjoying extensive treetop views.

St Mary's Village is within walking distance, while the beach of St Ouen's Bay and the airport is only ten minutes drive. The property is surrounded by a web of country lanes, perfect for dog walking.

Flags.DisplayName: Approved For Marketing on Printed Media

Descriptions.Text:
Set in some 10 vergees of woodland, paddock and cotil, this detached Jersey granite cottage has been considerably extended over the passage of time and will appeal to those seeking peace and privacy set in an unusually large area of land. With no immediate neighbours, the property lends itself to extension (subject to Planning permission), has exceptional parking and a newly built workshop building 7.5m x 4m. Terrific opportunities as a 2-3 generation home, on site business opportunities, vineyard, allotments etc. An extensive range of unexplored opportunities.

St Mary's Village, with its fine pub, church and convenience store/service station, is less than 1 mile away. Currently offering 3/4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, the property enjoys delightful views over the treetops and has a number of private barbecue patio areas.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Features.Feature: Set in 10 vergees of mature woodland and cotil

Features.Feature: Jersey Georgian House set in one acre
Derelict Coach House for Second Generation

Descriptions.Text: Approached by a long carriage driveway with electric entry gates, elegant and spacious Jersey Georgian house built in 1840, standing in almost an acre of mature garden, orchard and woodland. In excellent condition throughout, the property enjoys exceptional privacy and offers considerable scope, including a substantial undeveloped loft and a detached granite coach house, with plans previously to create a guest cottage.Though benefitting from a little modernisation, the accommodation is in sound order with four bedroom suites, a large attic ripe for conversion plus a sizable semi basement perfect for use as an office or play room. Accommodation includes sizable drawing and dining rooms, entrance and reception hallways, a snug and an eat-in kitchen with a sun terrace.Adjoining Radier Manor land to the rear, this substantial and sought after dwelling boasts spacious, lofty accommodation. An opportunity to acquire an exceptional and stylish small country estate in a very private and desirable setting.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

SummaryTextDescription: Situated in the lanes near la Hougue Bie, the property enjoys easy access to St Michael's School and the Colleges. The town is only 10 minutes drive away.

Descriptions.Text: St Saviour - M189
Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 2

Descriptions.Text: St Saviour - M189
Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 3

Descriptions.Text:
Peacefully situated in an enchanting rural hamlet, this beautiful grade 4 listed Georgian house has been refurbished throughout retaining most of the original charm and personality of the original. The reception rooms feature original restored oak parquet flooring and there is lovely country style kitchen/breakfast room.
The large basement has been restored to offer fantastic space as either a playroom, cinema or similar.
On the first floor, the developers have created a spacious guest suite plus 3 family bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. On the second floor, there is a fabulous master suite of bedroom, dressing room and bathroom.

There are charming gardens to the front and rear while a large parking area provides space for up to 20 vehicles.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Features.Feature: Newly refurbished to a High Standard

Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 1

SummaryTextDescription: The property is located in a stunning position high above Vallee des Vaux, and overlooks one of the island's most unspoilt and peaceful areas, yet is within easy reach of the town and secondary schools. Standing in approximately 7 vergees (almost 3 acres) this is home to a wide variety of wildlife, specifically herons, mallard ducks, moor hens, and a family of squirrels.

Flags.DisplayName: Approved For Marketing on Printed Media

Descriptions.Text:
This delightful and versatile contemporary home offers a wonderful selection of family accommodation and enjoys views from most rooms, extending right across the valley.
The accommodation is set out over four floors with each level having a specific purpose, with the design focusing on maximising its elevated outlook. From its long tree lined driveway, the entrance doorway provides access into this house of surprises.
The ground floor comprises a self contained studio apartment, perfect for an elderly relative.
The first floor is for family living and entertaining. With a very spacious open plan kitchen/breakfast/family room, snug, study, wine store, utility and wrap around decked terraces.
The second floor offers a superb drawing room and the beautiful master suite, both with access to a large sun deck perfect for enjoying the panoramic view.
The third floor has a fabulous guest suite, and a children's area offering two further en suite bedrooms and the two bedrooms share a well-equipped house bathroom.
A house that needs further inspection to appreciate what a magnificent home this is.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

Features.Feature: Terraces and sundecks in strategic locations

Descriptions.Text:
Tenure - Freehold 

Services - Mains electricity and drainage. Borehole water supply

Directions - Please call us for on directions on 713600

SummaryTextDescription: There can scarcely be a better location for family living! Quietly situated on a little used country lane in a small hamlet west of La Hougue Bie, the property offers easy access to the Colleges and to St Michael's School while town is a simple ten minute drive.

Flags.DisplayName: Approved For Marketing on Printed Media

Descriptions.Text:
Newly developed by one of the island's longest standing residential developers, this substantial home (4,300 sq ft approx.) has been created from an early nineteenth century barn. Externally retaining its period features and charm, internally the property offers modern contemporary living at its best, yet with a cosy ambience only an older building can create.
Its own private driveway offers plenty of parking and there is a double garage.
The garden with freshwater stream and pond is a delight, as is the "secret" garden - a fully enclosed former kitchen garden providing peaceful solace, perfect for a quiet read after a busy day.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing

A footpath leads down to the port, surrounded by its bustling bars and restaurants. On a clear day, the coast of the distant Normandy coastline is clearly visible.

Descriptions.Name: Additional Text 1

Descriptions.Text: The property is situated on la Route de la Cote overlooking the Mediaeval castle of Mont Orgeuil, standing high over the port of Gorey. A footpath leads down to the port, surrounded by its bustling bars and restaurants. On a clear day, the coast of the distant Normandy coastline is clearly visible.
Descriptions.Name: SummaryText

Descriptions.Text: This sumptuously appointed property commands panoramic views over the castle green of Mont Orgueil, the scenic port of Gorey with its vibrant restaurants and bars with the Royal Bay of Grouville in the distance.Standing on high ground attracting sunshine all day long, the property has been painstakingly re-built by the present owners utilising only the finest quality materials and finishes.Full Services: Mains electricity, water and drainage. Solar panel heating. 2 hydraulic lifts: garage lift to top of garden, main house pool room floor to 2nd floor. Electric Car turntable in garage. Geothermal heating consisting of 6 pipes 100 feet deep circulating water. 120 inch cinema screen linked to sky, movie server, Playstation and cameras controlled by a smart-home system. Camera system accessible from anywhere in the world. IR security system to all the rooms with external doors. Lutron lighting throughout the main property and the lodge –both units can be controlled with the same phone app. Sonos music system throughout the property. Apple music system through the TVs in the lodge. Climate controlled swimming pool. Outdoor lighting controlled by a phone APP from anywhere in the world where scheduling can be set or controlled manually. Garage door controlled by a phone APP from anywhere in the world where scheduling can be set or controlled manually.
Descriptions.Name: Main Marketing
